metadata.title: CVE-2014-8161 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
PostgreSQL before 9.0.19, 9.1.x before 9.1.15, 9.2.x before 9.2.10, 9.3.xbefore 9.3.6, and 9.4.x before 9.4.1 allows remote authenticated users toobtain sensitive column values by triggering constraint violation and thenreading the error message.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-8161` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

postgresql-plperl-9.1 - 9.1.15-0ubuntu0.14.04
No subscription required

libecpg-compat3 - 9.3.6-0ubuntu0.14.04
libecpg6 - 9.3.6-0ubuntu0.14.04
libpgtypes3 - 9.3.6-0ubuntu0.14.04
libpq5 - 9.3.6-0ubuntu0.14.04
postgresql-9.3 - 9.3.6-0ubuntu0.14.04
postgresql-client-9.3 - 9.3.6-0ubuntu0.14.04
postgresql-contrib-9.3 - 9.3.6-0ubuntu0.14.04
postgresql-plperl-9.3 - 9.3.6-0ubuntu0.14.04
postgresql-plpython-9.3 - 9.3.6-0ubuntu0.14.04
postgresql-plpython3-9.3 - 9.3.6-0ubuntu0.14.04
postgresql-pltcl-9.3 - 9.3.6-0ubuntu0.14.04
No subscription required

criterions.comment: postgresql-9.1 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '9.1.15-0ubuntu0.14.04').
postgresql-9.3 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '9.3.6-0ubuntu0.14.04').
